Resolve.Definition: A strong determination to do something
Resolve.Example: Superheroes succeed because they have the resolve to keep fighting even when a situation seems hopeless.

Aspires to.Definition: To have a strong desire to do or become something
Aspires to.Example: The actor has not been in a movie for then years, but he still aspires to stardom.

Keep.Definition: To have or retain possession of
Keep.Example: My father would keep the best for himself.

Excerpt.Definition: A short extract from a film, broadcast, or piece of music or writing
Excerpt.Example: Number the main ideas in the order they are developed in the excerpt given.

Versatile.Definition: Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities
Versatile.Example: He was versatile enough to play either position.

Attic.Definition: A space or room just below the roof of a building

Parade.Definition: A public procession, especially one celebrating a special day or event and including marching bands and floats
Parade.Example: The crowd cheered as one and the parade began.

Chandelier.Definition: A decorative hanging light with branches for several light bulbs or candles
Chandelier.Example: This chandelier will be perfect for our bedroom.

Pierce.Definition: (of a sharp pointed object) go into or through something
Pierce.Example: I had to pierce another hole in my belt.

Ambiguity.Definition: The quality of being open to more than one interpretation; inexactness
Ambiguity.Example: Ambiguities in such questions are potentially very dangerous.

Seamlessly.Definition: Smoothly and continuosly, with no apparent gaps or spaces between one part and the next
Seamlessly.Example: Each song is seamlessly integrated into the film.
